content:
**Which graph shows a quadratic function with domain $x<3$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by two. A graph of a line intersects the points (negative 3, 2) and (1, negative 1).

choices.content: ![A ray of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open unfilled circle at the point (3, 3). There is a curve from this point to the left that travels up to the point (negative 2, 8) and then back down to the bottom left edge of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/18c385f0fffaf55e20e323186a5edc53536a2f6a)

![A ray of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (3, 3). There is a curve from this point to the left that travels up to the point (negative 2, 8) and then back down to the bottom left edge of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/87d2e481a7434919c4d243891e63cd4ad5d92a52)

![A ray of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open unfilled circle at the point (4, negative 2). There is a curve from this point to the left that travels up to the point (negative 1, 3) and then back down to the bottom left edge of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/2b77fe8a0c3fe353b10f138dc19bae473a0c9227)

![A ray of a quadratic function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (4, negative 2). There is a curve from this point to the left that travels up to the point (negative 1, 3) and then back down to the bottom left edge of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/aa445881baec9a1e8869234ebf7a17571aaa0c69)
